channel.title: [PI]Cooking Timer[PI]
channel.description: Is there a way I can add a cooking timer to my cooking class?

item.title: [PI]Cooking Timer[PI]
item.dc:creator: @EmulousGuru EmulousGuru
item.description:
@EmulousGuru wrote:

Declare the cooking timer as an integer that you wish to be the timer.
(IE, “public int cookingTimer = 35;”)
Then, call the cookingTimer in each cooking method, then process the timer.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI]Cooking Timer[PI]
item.dc:creator: @Ix_Soulcist_xI Soulcist
item.description:
@Ix_Soulcist_xI wrote:

You are looking in Client.Java correct? Plus if you don’t have that line of code, then I would think this isn’t Project-Insanity because I’m sure their all the same.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI]Cooking Timer[PI]
item.dc:creator: @Impious_Lols Impious Lols
item.description:
@Impious_Lols wrote:

[quote=“Ix Soulcist xI, post:2, topic:364075”]You can look in Client.Java (\src\server\model\players).

Then search for; if (cooktimer > 0) cooktimer–;.

You should be able to see the code after that line. Its self explanatory after that mate.
I hope this helped, because I’m not positive I just now started looking.[/quote]
I don’t have a if (cooktimer > 0) cooktimer--;

Read full topic
